etymology.description: Depicts a carriage viewed from above; wheels on both sides + sun shade on top -> depicted vertically with wheels as strokes and loading area marked by 田(田) (tián, "field") -> 車
etymology.interpretation: The character 車(chē, "vehicle") originally depicts a carriage from an overhead perspective. The transformation into the vertical form involved simplifying the depiction of wheels and emphasizing the loading area, marked by a field symbol, creating a streamlined pictographic representation.
etymology.simplification: The traditional character 車 was simplified to 车 by reducing the number of strokes, maintaining the overall shape of the vehicle but removing intricate details.

examples.chinese: 我坐车去上班(我坐車去上班)。
examples.english: I take a car to go to work.

examples.chinese: 这辆车很快(這輛車很快)。
我想买一辆新车(我想買一輛新車)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng mǎi yī liàng xīn chē.
examples.english: I want to buy a new car.
